Andrew Rymer

Front End Developer

What I Do

I am a self taught graphic artist, who after 5 years, made a career change to web development as a Full Stack Engineer with a specialization in the Front End. My love for technology, learning, and design fueled my desire to expand my career options and bring my creative thinking and problem solving to web development. I’m continually inspired by the problems and solutions I get to explore on the job. I think it’s very important in this, and any creative career, to always be a student. To stay open to continued learning and not letting one’s ego get in the way.

Acquired Skill Set

Over the last 6 years I have had the privilege to work with many different programming languages and stacks. Most recently I worked on a small 4 man team using the LAMP stack with CakePHP on the backend and VueJS on the front end. My role was to develop new features and provide continued support across other areas of a k-12 school inventory application. The project specifically cataloged technology assets across students and staff. I’ve also worked with 1 other front end engineer to re-write/design the main customer facing application for an auto loan company using Angular 10. My earlier experiences consisted of developing a fuel use prototype using a custom in house php framework for Clemson University, as well as re-writing the checkout system of an e-commerce company and tying it into a stand alone administration application I helped design and develop.

In what spare time I currently have with an ever expanding family, I enjoy painting, drawing, miniature building and painting, and playing with my daughter and two dogs. I also like to set aside time for continued education and keeping myself up to date with what is changing in the development world.

Portfolio

Boat Covers Direct

Car Covers Direct
